name: places/ChIJ3aY5yXpZwokRvM38zWgXofs
formattedAddress: 246 W 16th St, New York, NY 10011, USA
adrFormatAddress: 246 W 16th St, New York, NY 10011-6101, USA

originalText.text:
I went to the Maker Hotel Shop just before attending a wedding after trying quite a few fragrances elsewhere. All their offerings smell very natural, which I liked.

Thais (and pup Ziggy) took me through everything, including their candles, while I tried guessing the ingredients. It was a nice break on a rainy day. I went home with a few of the generous samples to see how they worked with my skin's chemistry. After a day or two, I ultimately landed on "Wild".

If you have loved ones who are sensitive to smells or simply don't want to be "that person" on an elevator, know that you have to be quite close to pick up the scent.

Everyone I've had smell the whole assortment has loved everything, and there's a new fragrance on the way. So it's definitely with a peek.

originalText.text: The Maker has been on my block for the past year or so and I was a little reluctant to go in because it's so beautiful and gorgeous from the outside.  Now, let. me just say that this is NOW my go-to spot for gifts (esp for picky people). I had to go to a birthday party and get a gift for a new male friend who I didn't know so well. The staff was super helpful with selecting a candle (the garden tomato scent). As it turns out, the friend was a huge fan of Maker and he loved the gift more than the Gucci wallet, but that's besides the point.   I've also sampled their jams (delicious) and am a recent purchaser of the same candle and perfume. This is a great choice for that super picky person who has everything or that random new friend you want to send a warm friendly not over the top gesture of friendship to.

originalText.text: With all the bloviating "lifestyle brands" competing for your attention, please take time to consider this remarkable shop led by an incredible team of warm, thoughtful experts in design and curated ambience.  We have purchased many products here, from their jewel-toned cushions to candles, fragrances, glassware, and even their heirloom quality "Louise Bed" (even better than the photos).  The Shop is a beautiful oasis on W. 16th Street in Manhattan, and the team there applies absolutely zero sales pressure while receiving guests.  The entire experience feels like spending time with old friends who happen to have stunningly gorgeous products available if you're interested -- very relaxed.  The follow-up customer service is impeccable, and genuinely shared -- something that takes getting used to for those of us accustomed to waiting for the catch to any display of commercial generosity.  The Maker Shop enjoys our strongest recommendation, a place we will continue to visit in the years to come.
